alert.note: Alert for Berrien; Brooks; Cook; Lanier; Lowndes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 22 at 5:37PM EST until January 22 at 7:15PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Cook County in south central Georgia... Southeastern Berrien County in south central Georgia... Lanier County in south central Georgia... Lowndes County in south central Georgia... Southeastern Brooks County in south central Georgia... * Until 715 PM EST. * At 537 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Alapaha to 10 miles southwest of Quitman, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Lake Park, Lakeland, Valdosta, Hahira, Ray City, I-75 At Exit 16, Moody Air Force Base, Remerton, Meigs, Dasher, Barretts, New Lois, Hansell, Nankin, Empress, Allenville, Clyattville, Weber, I-75 At Exit 11 and Teeterville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
